GSILib.BSystem

Class BusinessSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • GSILib.BSystem.BusinessSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EditorialOffice, ODSPersistent, XMLRepresentable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PublicBusinessSystem

    public class BusinessSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements EditorialOffice, ODSPersistent, XMLRepresentable
    This is the class BusinessSystem. In this class we implement the system it self with help of all the classes of the model.

      • addReviewer

        public boolean addReviewer(PrintableNews pn,
                           Journalist rw)
        Description copied from interface: EditorialOffice
        Adds a journalist as reviewer of an existing news. If the news or the journalist did not exist in the system the operation must have no effect and return false.
        Specified by:
        addReviewer in interface EditorialOffice
        Parameters:
        pn - The printable news to which we are adding a reviewer.
        rw - The reviewer
        Returns:
        true if and only if (a) the news and the journalist existed, (b) the latter wasn't listed as a reviewer of the former, and (c) it was correctly added as such.

        Specified by:
        removeReviewer in interface EditorialOffice
        Parameters:
        pn - printable news
        rw - reviewer to be removed
        Returns:
        true if and only if (a) the news and the journalist existed, (b) the latter was listed as a reviewer of the former, and (c) it was correctly removed.

                              PrintableNews pn)
        Description copied from interface: EditorialOffice

        Specified by:
        addNewsToIssue in interface EditorialOffice

        Returns:

      • importPrintableNews

        public int importPrintableNews(java.io.File f)
        Reads the PrintableNews from an .ods file and imports them into the system. In order to make a way to import variable thing, we are going to put a separator between the data. It is, first of all, we are going to take the usual data of a printable news and then we take the prizes, then an asterics (*), then the reviewers, then an # and last the pictures. Putting the * and # is compulsory.
        Parameters:
        f - The input file (.ods, Open Office spreadsheet) to read from
        Returns:
        the number of PrintableNews correctly added to the system

      • loadFromFile

        public boolean loadFromFile(java.io.File f)
        Description copied from interface: ODSPersistent
        This file loads from a file the instances needed to populate a business model. The method must close the file after finishing, and return a true value if and only if: a) The file existed, was accessible, and could be closed after analysis, b) The contents of the file did follow the expected format, AND c) The system could read the information from the file with no error or interruption.
        Specified by:
        loadFromFile in interface ODSPersistent
        Parameters:
        f - File from which the info is to be read.
        Returns:
        A result of the process according to the rules above.

      • saveToFile

        public boolean saveToFile(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: ODSPersistent
        This file loads from a file the instances needed to populate a business model. The resulting file must be according to the pre-specified rules, so that any file f written by this method should be readable by means of the execution of loadFromFile(f).
        Specified by:
        saveToFile in interface ODSPersistent
        Parameters:
        file - The destination file.
        Returns:
        true if the information could be safely stored.

      • loadFromFileXML

        public static BusinessSystem loadFromFileXML(java.io.File file)
                                      throws XMLParsingException,
                                             java.io.IOException,
                                             org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                             java.text.ParseException
        Main method which imports a BusinessSystem from an XML file which contains complete data of all the classes which conform the business system.
        Parameters:
        file - XML type file
        Returns:
        a business system with all the inclusions that XML defines.
        Throws:
        XMLParsingException - exception derived from XML parsing.
        java.io.IOException - exception derived from io.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - exception derived from SAXException (data consistency).
        java.text.ParseException - exception derived from Parsing.

      • saveToFileXML

        public boolean saveToFileXML(java.io.File file)
        Auxiliary method to store a file type to an XML
        Parameters:
        file - file desired to store
        Returns:
        true if correctly stored, false otherwise
